tests

Class MeasureTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • tests.MeasureTest

  • public class MeasureTest
extends java.lang.Object
    Tests the Measure class with a variety of inputs. Test partitions: Major keys with flats, major keys with sharps, minor keys with flats, minor keys with sharps, C Major (key with no flats or sharps).

      • testEqualsKeySigMeasuresWithAccidentals

        public void testEqualsKeySigMeasuresWithAccidentals()
        Tests equality and inequality for Measures with Key Signatures and Accidentals.

      • testEqualsObject

        public void testEqualsObject()
        Tests equality and inequality for a measure with both chords and tuplets.

      • testEqualsSyllables

        public void testEqualsSyllables()
        Tests equality and inequality for a measure with syllables.

      • testGetChords

        public void testGetChords()
        Tests getChords() on a measure with Chords, Rests, and Tuplets. This measure has no accidentals, key signature, or syllables.

      • testGetChordsWithAccidentals

        public void testGetChordsWithAccidentals()
        Tests that a measure correctly applies accidentals with getChords(). Tests both single and double accidentals. Tests both single and double octave transposes. Also tests that accidentals are not "doubly applied" when specified in both a key signature and an accidental on the note. For example, if there was an F# in E Major, it would remain as F# and not F double sharp.

      • testGetChordsWithKeySig

        public void testGetChordsWithKeySig()
        Tests that a measure correctly applies a key signature on getChords().

      • testgetChordsWithSyllables

        public void testgetChordsWithSyllables()
        Tests that getChords() correctly applies syllables to chords. This case tests for when there are fewer syllables than notes, when a syllable is held for more than one note, and when a syllable is held for exactly one note.

      • testHashCode

        public void testHashCode()
        Tests hash codes for equal and unequal Measure objects that just contain Chords and Tuples.
